wikipedia_page.main: John Symonds Udal (10 November 1848 in West Bromwich, Staffordshire, England – 13 March 1925 in London) was an English-born cricketer, antiquarian, author, lawyer and judge. He represented the Fiji national cricket team. He also held government office in Fiji for many years, serving as Attorney-General from 1889 to 1899. He later served as Chief Justice of the Leeward Islands (1900 - 1911).

response: Fiji's team on the tour in 1895 was captained by John Udal, whose great-grandson Shaun would eventually play Test cricket for England.John Udal at Cricket Archive The first match of the tour was a two-day match against Auckland, which Fiji lost by an innings.Scorecard of Auckland v Fiji, 25 January 1895 at Cricket Archive
His grandfather John Udal as Attorney-General in Fiji and did much to encourage cricket there. His grandson Shaun Udal has represented Hampshire, Middlesex and England.
*John Udal (1848–1925), English-born cricketer, antiquarian, author, lawyer and judge
